macro_markets.query: What are the most important macroeconomic and stock market news and developments from the past 24 hours? Include major index movements, Fed/central bank news, and significant company earnings or announcements.

items.title: Wall Street rally pauses as S&P 500 slips from record while Nasdaq edges higher
items.summary: U.S. stocks saw a mixed session as the S&P 500 fell 0.3% from its latest all-time high and the Dow Jones Industrial Average dropped 466 points (0.9%) from its own record, while the Nasdaq composite rose 0.2%, reflecting a slowdown in the strong start to the year.[1]

items.title: U.S. Treasury yields swing on mixed economic data and service-sector strength
items.summary: Treasury yields fluctuated after reports showed U.S. services-sector growth accelerated more than expected last month while a key inflation gauge in the same survey eased to its lowest level since March, complicating the outlook for interest rates.[1]

items.title: Fed rate-cut expectations ease as traders price low odds of imminent move
items.summary: Despite prior cuts last year to support a slowing job market, the Federal Reserve is now expected by futures markets to hold rates at its next meeting, with CME Group data showing traders assign less than a 12% probability to a January rate cut as inflation remains above target.[1]

items.title: Warner Bros. Discovery rejects Paramount bid again, backs rival Netflix-linked offer
items.summary: Warner Bros. Discovery shares rose 0.4% after the company again rejected a buyout bid from Paramount and urged shareholders to support a competing offer tied to Netflix, while Paramount Skydance slipped 1% and Netflix edged up 0.1%.[1]

crypto_news.query: What are the most significant cryptocurrency and blockchain news from the past 24 hours? Include major price movements, regulatory news, and notable project developments.

items.title: Bitcoin trades around $91,000 as crypto market shows first signs of 2026 recovery
items.summary: Bitcoin has rebounded from December lows near $85,000 and is trading around $91,000–$92,000, pushing total crypto market capitalization back above $3 trillion and lifting major altcoins 5–10% in early January amid improving risk sentiment.

items.title: Bitcoin market structure resets after 2025 deleveraging, Glassnode notes early 2026 revival
items.summary: Glassnode’s latest market report says Bitcoin has cleared a large portion of legacy spot, futures, and options positions after a year-end deleveraging, with ETF flows stabilizing, derivatives participation rebuilding, and options skew turning more bullish, suggesting a shift back toward risk-taking.

items.title: BTC/USD dips below $91,000 while Ethereum holds near $3,100
items.summary: Short-term trading updates show Bitcoin slipping back under $91,000 in a wide intraday range, while Ethereum consolidates around the $3,100 level as traders watch for a potential breakout from current resistance.

items.title: Technical outlook: Bitcoin correction eyed toward $90,200 before potential push toward $96,700
items.summary: A fresh BTC/USD technical analysis projects a near-term test of support around $90,205 within a bullish channel, followed by a possible rebound with upside targets near $96,765, while warning that a drop through ~$85,205 would threaten the uptrend.

items.title: XRP slips 5% to $2.18 after being dubbed 2026’s ‘hottest trade’ over Bitcoin and Ether
items.summary: XRP fell about 5% to $2.18 after failing to hold above $2.28, cooling an early-2026 rally that prompted CNBC to call the token the new ‘crypto darling’ and a top trade over Bitcoin and Ethereum.

items.title: Major altcoins strengthen as Solana, BNB and others extend early-2026 gains
items.summary: Broader altcoin markets are firming, with Solana up roughly 15% in the first week of January to around $150 on DeFi and payments growth, BNB holding above $800 despite ongoing legal pressure on Binance, and most top coins advancing while still below prior all-time highs.

items.title: January 2026 token unlocks loom for Ondo, Sei, Plume and other projects
items.summary: A set of significant token unlocks for projects including Ondo, Sei and Plume is scheduled across January, adding fresh circulating supply and drawing investor attention to potential market impact on these ecosystems.

ai_news.query: What are the most important artificial intelligence and machine learning news and developments from the past 24 hours? Include new model releases, company announcements, research breakthroughs, and industry trends.

items.title: ASUS showcases full-spectrum AI hardware and tools at CES 2026, including new UGen300 USB AI accelerator
items.summary: ASUS announced a broad AI strategy at CES 2026 spanning seven scenarios—AI Infrastructure, Sustainability AI, Workspace AI, Industrial AI, Everyday AI, Creator AI, and Healthcare AI—and unveiled products such as the UGen300 USB AI Accelerator for edge generative AI, ProArt creator laptops with AI-enhanced workflows, and the Zenbook DUO, which received a CES 2026 Innovation Award in the Artificial Intelligence category.[1]

items.title: NASA validates EdgeCortix SAKURA‑II radiation‑resilient AI accelerator for space and lunar missions
items.summary: EdgeCortix announced that its SAKURA‑II AI co‑processor passed NASA heavy‑ion radiation testing without destructive events and with limited transient effects, confirming its suitability for low Earth orbit, geosynchronous, and lunar deployments and enabling low‑power, on‑orbit machine learning and computer vision for autonomous space systems.[2]

items.title: Japanese researchers use large language models to mine experimental data from scientific papers for materials databases
items.summary: A team in Tsukuba reported tools that use large language models via the Starrydata2 system to automatically extract structured experimental data—such as sample information and figures—from open‑access materials science papers, aiming to accelerate creation of large property databases and improve machine‑learning‑based materials discovery while working within publisher AI-use restrictions.[3]

items.title: Grab acquires Chinese AI robotics firm Infermove to boost last‑mile delivery automation
items.summary: Grab Holdings has acquired China‑based Infermove, an AI robotics company, in a strategic move to strengthen its last‑mile delivery capabilities, signaling continued consolidation and investment in AI‑driven logistics and warehouse automation in the on‑demand services sector.[6]

items.title: US jury selected for trial of former Google engineer accused of stealing AI trade secrets
items.summary: A federal jury of 11 members and 2 alternates has been chosen for the US criminal trial of an ex‑Google engineer charged with stealing artificial intelligence secrets, underscoring intensifying legal and regulatory scrutiny over ownership and protection of AI technologies.[5]

gaming.query: What are the most notable video game and gaming industry news from the past 24 hours? Include game releases, announcements, esports, and industry developments.

items.title: New Game Plus Showcase Debuts Today with 45 Upcoming Games
items.summary: The New Game Plus Showcase, a new livestream event created by content creators, launches today (January 8, 2026) at 1:00pm PT / 4:00pm ET, featuring 45 upcoming AAA and indie titles with gameplay footage and developer interviews. Notable games include Shadow of the Road (Atomic Heart sequel) and Atomic Heart 2 (MMO spin-off).

items.title: Wolfenstein 3 Reportedly in Development at MachineGames
items.summary: New reports indicate that Wolfenstein 3 is finally in development after years of speculation, marking a potential return for the classic franchise.

items.title: New Xbox Hardware Expected in 2026
items.summary: Microsoft is reportedly planning to release new Xbox hardware this year, with speculation pointing to the Xbox Elite Series 3 Controller featuring direct-to-WiFi connectivity to reduce cloud gaming latency.

items.title: Grand Theft Auto 6 Release Date Under Scrutiny
items.summary: Grand Theft Auto 6 remains scheduled for November 19, 2026, but recent analysis from gaming journalists has raised concerns about the release timeline.

items.title: Elder Scrolls Online 2026 Reveal Stream Generates Mixed Reactions
items.summary: The Elder Scrolls Online held its 2026 reveal stream, with community feedback focusing on animation changes and new subscription tier structures.

tech_news.query: What are the most important technology news and developments from the past 24 hours? Include major product launches, company news, and significant tech industry developments. Exclude AI-specific news.

items.title: Intel unveils Core Ultra Series 3 'Panther Lake' laptop processors at CES 2026
items.summary: Intel introduced its new Core Ultra Series 3 'Panther Lake' chips at CES 2026, highlighting major gains in performance and power efficiency over the previous Lunar Lake generation and positioning them as the foundation for a new wave of high-end laptops.

items.title: CES 2026 showcases standout new consumer gadgets across TVs, laptops, phones, and smart glasses
items.summary: CES 2026 featured a range of notable hardware launches, including an ultra-thin TV, a gaming laptop with a rollable 16–24 inch display, advanced robot vacuums able to climb stairs, upgraded Xreal 1S smart glasses, and new flagship laptops with tandem OLED screens and large batteries.

items.title: Entertainment and tech companies highlight advanced consumer hardware and services at CES 2026
items.summary: At CES 2026, entertainment and tech leaders showcased next-generation televisions, AI-powered smart headphones, a 'stringless smart guitar', and a 'sound chair' with built-in audio, underscoring ongoing convergence between consumer electronics and digital entertainment.

items.title: FDA moves to relax rules on low-risk digital health gadgets unveiled at CES
items.summary: During CES in Las Vegas, the U.S. Food and Drug Administration announced it will ease regulations on 'low-risk' general wellness products such as heart monitors and wheelchairs, a shift expected to accelerate the rollout of new connected health devices while raising questions about data privacy and oversight.

items.title: Iluvatar CoreX surges over 30% in Hong Kong trading debut
items.summary: Chinese chipmaker Iluvatar CoreX jumped 31.54% on its first day of trading, as investors bet on its position as a leading domestic provider of high-performance GPGPU chips, underscoring strong market demand for local computing hardware amid ongoing tech supply chain shifts.
